alert.note: Alert for Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 8:14PM EDT until July 27 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL FLEMING COUNTY... At 814 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms sagging south of the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain has fallen since 6:30 PM. While the heaviest rainfall has subsided, excessive runoff will continue through 9 PM, causing flash flooding along small streams and creeks, especially in low lying areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cowan, Pecks Ridge and Craintown. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
